title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp decides to start Alisson and Joel Matip against Man Utd
text:
Alisson has returned to full fitness in time for Liverpool’s trip to Manchester United (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp has reportedly decided to start both Alisson and Joel Matip against Manchester United this weekend.

Alisson suffered a calf injury during Liverpool’s opening match of the season against Norwich and has not featured since, with Adrian playing every minute in the Premier League between the sticks.

The Brazil goalkeeper returned to light work at the start of last month and finally joined up with his team-mates in full training this week ahead of Liverpool’s trip to Old Trafford.

Joel Matip also trained at Melwood after picking up a knock before the international break and both players came through Tuesday’s session unscathed.

Klopp has decided to start Matip at Old Trafford (Picture: Getty)

According to The Daily Mirror, the pair did enough to convince Klopp that they are ready to face bitter rivals United on Sunday afternoon.

Mohamed Salah remains a doubt for the clash as he continues his recovery from an ankle injury he sustained against Leicester.

Naby Keita trained as usual after he was rested for Guineas two matches during the international break, while Sadio Mane is expected to be back on Wednesday.

Roberto Firmino and Fabinho are set to return to Merseyside on Thursday following Brazil’s friendlies with Senegal and Nigeria.

Michael Owen, who controversially turned out for both United and Liverpool during his playing days, has predicted a comfortable win for Klopp’s side this weekend.

‘Manchester United have won just two of their last 13 league games (D5 L6) and a barometer of their performance at St James’ Park last time was that central defender Harry Maguire had more touches (4) in the Magpies penalty area than any other United player,’ Owen told BetVictor.

‘Liverpool will equal Manchester City’s record of 18 successive league wins if they win at Old Trafford.

‘Jurgen Klopp’s side have ridden their luck in recent weeks, but I expect them to have too much pace and aggression for this United side, although Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will be hopeful that he can call on the services of at least a couple of his key players returning from injury or illness.’

Solskjaer is under serious pressure ahead of the clash (Picture: Getty)

Despite United’s woeful run of form, Solskjaer believes the clash with Liverpool comes at a ‘perfect’ time for his players.

Advertisement

‘That’s a perfect game for us,’ the Norwegian said after United’s miserable defeat to Newcastle.

‘The international break is also at the perfect time because their heads need a bit of airing. It doesn’t help having a meeting tomorrow.’

He added: ‘They will go away with their national teams, meet their team-mates and come back fresh.

‘We have had a good time together, we have prepared since the first day of pre-season, we have stuck to the same principles.

‘We have not got the result today but we have to keep carrying on.’
